tool_description: Superfeedr allows you to subscribe to content on the web, and receive push notifications in real-time when new content is published. It also allows you to retrieve past content, and we’ve also got a range of normalization options that make for easier consumption.
name: Superfeedr
title: Superfeedr

api_list.name: Listing subscriptions
api_list.description: This call will allow you to retrieve subscriptions on your account. This call allows you to retrieve subscriptions on your account. You can also use the search parameter to find subscriptions to specific feeds.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: If there are more than 20 matching subscriptions, you may want to paginate over them. First page (default) is 1.

optional_parameters.name: by_page
optional_parameters.description: Number of items per page. Max is 500. Min is 1.

optional_parameters.name: search
optional_parameters.description: A search query. Please see superfeedr docus for the various fields and values to use.

api_list.name: Retrieving Past Content
api_list.description: This call allows you to retrieve past entries from one or more feeds. Note that you need to be subscribed to the feed(s) in order to do this.

optional_parameters.name: hub.topic
optional_parameters.description: The URL of the HTTP resource for which you want the past entries.

optional_parameters.name: hub.callback
optional_parameters.description: The value can either be a callback with which you are subscribed to one or more feeds or a search query that should match one or more callback urls used to subscribed to several feeds. Please, use the query syntax used to search for subscriptions. In both cases, make sure there are less than 200 matching feeds.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: Optional number of items you want to retrieve. Current max is 50 and default is 10.

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: The id of an entry in the feed. The response will only include entries published before this one.

optional_parameters.name: after
optional_parameters.description: The id of an entry in the feed. The response will only include entries published after this one.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: json if you want to retrieve entries in json format (for feeds only!).

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: This will render the entries as a JSONP.
